queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for unauthorized API calls

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { $.errorCode = *UnauthorizedOperation || $.errorCode = AccessDenied* } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { $.errorCode = *UnauthorizedOperation || $.errorCode = AccessDenied* } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.description: AWS DB Instance should have its storage encrypted by setting the parameter to 'true'. The storage_encrypted default value is 'false'.

files.expected_value: 'storage_encrypted' should be set to true

queries.description: Elastic File System (EFS) must be encrypted

files.expected_value: aws_efs_file_system[wordpress_efs].encrypted' should be defined and not null

queries.description: Query to find passwords and secrets in infrastructure code.

files.expected_value: Hardcoded secret key should not appear in source
files.actual_value: Hardcoded secret key appears in source

queries.query_name: Sensitive Port Is Exposed To Entire Network
queries.description: A sensitive port, such as port 23 or port 110, is open for the whole network in either TCP or UDP protocol

files.expected_value: HTTPS (TCP:443) should not be allowed
HTTP (TCP:80) should not be allowed
SSH (TCP:22) should not be allowed

queries.description: Security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0:0 and/or ::/0

files.expected_value: One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'
One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'
One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'

queries.description: Application Load Balancer should have deletion protection enabled

files.expected_value: 'enable_deletion_protection' should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: ALB Is Not Integrated With WAF
queries.description: All Application Load Balancers (ALB) must be protected with Web Application Firewall (WAF) service

files.expected_value: 'aws_alb[wordpress_alb]' should not be 'internal' and has a 'aws_wafregional_web_acl_association' associated
files.actual_value: 'aws_alb[wordpress_alb]' is not 'internal' and does not have a 'aws_wafregional_web_acl_association' associated

queries.description: AWS Application Load Balancer (alb) should not listen on HTTP

files.expected_value: 'default_action.redirect.protocol' should be equal to 'HTTPS'

queries.description: It's considered a best practice when using Application Load Balancers to drop invalid header fields

files.expected_value: aws_alb[{{wordpress_alb}}].drop_invalid_header_fields should be set to true

queries.query_name: Auto Scaling Group With No Associated ELB
queries.description: AWS Auto Scaling Groups must have associated ELBs to ensure high availability and improve application performance. This means the attribute 'load_balancers' must be defined and not empty.

files.expected_value: aws_autoscaling_group[wordpress_asg].load_balancers should be set and not empty

queries.description: AWS CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled to collect all viewer requests, which means the attribute 'logging_config' should be defined

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cloudfront].logging_config should be defined

queries.description: All AWS CloudFront distributions should be integrated with the Web Application Firewall (AWS WAF) service

files.expected_value: 'web_acl_id'  should exist

queries.query_name: CloudWatch AWS Config Configuration Changes Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Config configuration changes

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { ($.eventSource = config.amazonaws.com) && (($.eventName=StopConfigurationRecorder)||($.eventName=DeleteDeliveryChannel)||($.eventName=PutDeliveryChannel)||($.eventName=PutConfigurationRecorder)) } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { ($.eventSource = config.amazonaws.com) && (($.eventName=StopConfigurationRecorder)||($.eventName=DeleteDeliveryChannel)||($.eventName=PutDeliveryChannel)||($.eventName=PutConfigurationRecorder)) } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.query_name: CloudWatch Changes To NACL Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to NACL

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { ($.eventName = CreateNetworkAcl) || ($.eventName = CreateNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = DeleteNetworkAcl) || ($.eventName = DeleteNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = ReplaceNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = ReplaceNetworkAclAssociation) } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { ($.eventName = CreateNetworkAcl) || ($.eventName = CreateNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = DeleteNetworkAcl) || ($.eventName = DeleteNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = ReplaceNetworkAclEntry) || ($.eventName = ReplaceNetworkAclAssociation) } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.query_name: CloudWatch Disabling Or Scheduled Deletion Of Customer Created CMK Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMK

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern{ ($.eventSource = kms.amazonaws.com) && (($.eventName = DisableKey) || ($.eventName = ScheduleKeyDeletion)) } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern{ ($.eventSource = kms.amazonaws.com) && (($.eventName = DisableKey) || ($.eventName = ScheduleKeyDeletion)) } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.description: AWS CloudWatch Log groups should be encrypted using KMS

files.expected_value: Attribute 'kms_key_id' should be set

queries.description: Check if CloudWatch logging is disabled for Route53 hosted zones

files.expected_value: 'aws_route53_query_log' should be set for respective 'aws_route53_zone'

queries.query_name: CloudWatch Management Console Auth Failed Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Management Console authentication failures

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { $.eventName = ConsoleLogin && $.errorMessage = "Failed authentication" } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { $.eventName = ConsoleLogin && $.errorMessage = "Failed authentication" } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for root acount usage

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { $.userIdentity.type = "Root" && $.userIdentity.invokedBy NOT EXISTS && $.eventType != "AwsServiceEvent" } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { $.userIdentity.type = "Root" && $.userIdentity.invokedBy NOT EXISTS && $.eventType != "AwsServiceEvent" } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.query_name: CloudWatch S3 policy Change Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for S3 bucket policy changes

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern $.eventSource equal to `s3.amazonaws.com` and $.eventName equal to `PutBucketAcl`, `PutBucketPolicy`, `PutBucketCors`, `PutBucketLifecycle`, `PutBucketReplication`, `DeleteBucketPolicy`, `DeleteBucketCors`, `DeleteBucketLifecycle` and `DeleteBucketReplication`
aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for VPC changes

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { ($.eventName = CreateVpc) || ($.eventName = DeleteVpc) || ($.eventName = ModifyVpcAttribute) || ($.eventName = AcceptVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = CreateVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = DeleteVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = RejectVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = AttachClassicLinkVpc) || ($.eventName = DetachClassicLinkVpc) || ($.eventName = DisableVpcClassicLink) || ($.eventName = EnableVpcClassicLink) } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { ($.eventName = CreateVpc) || ($.eventName = DeleteVpc) || ($.eventName = ModifyVpcAttribute) || ($.eventName = AcceptVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = CreateVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = DeleteVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = RejectVpcPeeringConnection) || ($.eventName = AttachClassicLinkVpc) || ($.eventName = DetachClassicLinkVpc) || ($.eventName = DisableVpcClassicLink) || ($.eventName = EnableVpcClassicLink) } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.query_name: Cloudfront Viewer Protocol Policy Allows HTTP
queries.description: Checks if the connection between CloudFront and the viewer is encrypted

files.expected_value: resource.aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cloudfront].default_cache_behavior.viewer_protocol_policy should be 'https-only' or 'redirect-to-https'

queries.query_name: Cloudwatch Cloudtrail Configuration Changes Alarm Missing
queries.description: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for CloudTrail configuration changes

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { ($.eventName = CreateTrail) || ($.eventName = UpdateTrail) || ($.eventName = DeleteTrail) || ($.eventName = StartLogging) || ($.eventName = StopLogging) } and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { ($.eventName = CreateTrail) || ($.eventName = UpdateTrail) || ($.eventName = DeleteTrail) || ($.eventName = StartLogging) || ($.eventName = StopLogging) } or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.query_name: Cloudwatch Security Group Changes Alarm Missing

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter should have pattern { ($.eventName = AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress) || ($.eventName = AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress) || ($.eventName = RevokeSecurityGroupIngress) || ($.eventName = RevokeSecurityGroupEgress) || ($.eventName = CreateSecurityGroup) || ($.eventName = DeleteSecurityGroup)} and be associated an aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm
files.actual_value: aws_cloudwatch_log_metric_filter not filtering pattern { ($.eventName = AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress) || ($.eventName = AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress) || ($.eventName = RevokeSecurityGroupIngress) || ($.eventName = RevokeSecurityGroupEgress) || ($.eventName = CreateSecurityGroup) || ($.eventName = DeleteSecurityGroup)} or not associated with any aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm

queries.description: ElastiCache should not use the default port (an attacker can easily guess the port). For engine set to Redis, the default port is 6379. The Memcached default port is 11211

files.expected_value: 'port' should not be set to 11211

files.expected_value: 'aws_accessanalyzer_analyzer' should be set

queries.description: ElastiCache should have Redis enabled, since it covers Compliance Certifications such as FedRAMP, HIPAA, and PCI DSS. For more information, take a look at 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/mem-ug/SelectEngine.html'

files.expected_value: resource.aws_elasticache_cluster[wordpress_elasticache].engine should have Redis enabled

queries.query_name: S3 Bucket Without Enabled MFA Delete
queries.description: S3 bucket without MFA Delete Enabled. MFA delete cannot be enabled through Terraform, it can be done by adding a MFA device (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_mfa_enable.html) and enabling versioning and MFA delete by using AWS CLI: 'aws s3api put-bucket-versioning --versioning-configuration=Status=Enabled,MFADelete=Enabled --bucket=<BUCKET_NAME> --mfa=<MFA_SERIAL_NUMBER>'. Please, also notice that MFA delete can not be used with lifecycle configurations

files.expected_value: 'mfa_delete' should be set to true

files.actual_value: aws_route53_zone does not have shield advanced associated

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution has shield advanced associated
files.actual_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution does not have shield advanced associated
